intro: Actinocarya bhutanica, commonly known as the Bhutan goldenbush, is a rare flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its yellowish-green leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high elevations. Its botanical features include thick, waxy leaves that help retain moisture in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
